qa_list.question: What is Carnegie Mellon's campus size?
qa_list.answer: Carnegie Mellon has a 140-acre urban campus.

qa_list.question: Where is the largest public park in Pittsburgh located?
qa_list.answer: The largest public park in Pittsburgh, Schenley Park, is located next to Carnegie Mellon's campus.

qa_list.question: What kind of sports facilities does Carnegie Mellon Athletics have?
qa_list.answer: Carnegie Mellon has a picturesque stadium for football and track games, a natatorium with natural lighting, and the only dedicated soccer facility in the University Athletic Association. They are also constructing a new performance gym for basketball and volleyball.

qa_list.question: What is the purpose of the Performance Gym at Carnegie Mellon?
qa_list.answer: The Performance Gym will be used for indoor training for all sports, including volleyball and basketball.

qa_list.question: How many student-athletes identify as ADPI at Carnegie Mellon?
qa_list.answer: Almost 30% of the Tartans identify as ADPI (Asians, Desis, and Pacific Islanders).

qa_list.question: What is the purpose of the Black and Latinx Athlete Coalition?
qa_list.answer: The Black and Latinx Athlete Coalition provides a cohesive, centralized affinity group for support, camaraderie, and mentorship amongst Black and Latinx student-athletes and alumni.

qa_list.question: What is the Plaidvocates program at Carnegie Mellon?
qa_list.answer: The Plaidvocates are a peer health and wellness advocacy program for student-athletes that supports the well-being of CMU’s varsity athletics community.

qa_list.question: What is Carnegie Mellon's commitment to campus life?
qa_list.answer: Carnegie Mellon has a dedicated green space and a residential feel due to their commitment to campus life.

qa_list.question: What is the Black and Latinx Athlete Coalition?
qa_list.answer: The Black and Latinx Athlete Coalition is a cohesive, centralized affinity group and network of support, camaraderie and mentorship amongst Black and Latinx student-athletes and alumni.

qa_list.question: What is the purpose of Plaidvocates?
qa_list.answer: Plaidvocates are a peer health and wellness advocacy program for student-athletes that supports the well-being of CMU’s varsity athletics community.

qa_list.question: What is the Student-Athlete Advisory Council (SAAC)?
qa_list.answer: The SAAC works to promote the student-athlete voice and engage in community outreach.

qa_list.question: What is the SMART Program?
qa_list.answer: The Sports Medicine Assessment of Risk Tendencies (SMART) Protocol is a proactive, cutting-edge approach to providing varsity student-athletes with services they need to remain healthy and educated about their well-being.

qa_list.question: What is the purpose of Tartan Leaders of Tomorrow?
qa_list.answer: Tartan Leaders of Tomorrow is a program in which Carnegie Mellon Student-Athletes evolve as leaders through engaging speakers, thoughtful discussion, campus outreach, engagement and proactive mentorship.

qa_list.question: What does the department of athletics partners with for special events?
qa_list.answer: The department of athletics partners with the Career and Professional Development Center for special events that are centered around student-athletes connecting with employers.

qa_list.question: Why is Pittsburgh a good place to live according to Livability.com?
qa_list.answer: Pittsburgh ranked #9 in Livability.com's 2022 ranking of Top 100 Best Places to Live.

qa_list.question: What makes Pittsburgh a good place for young professionals according to Niche.com?
qa_list.answer: Pittsburgh ranked #10 in Niche.com's 2022 ranking of Best cities for young professionals in America.

qa_list.question: What makes Pittsburgh a green city?
qa_list.answer: Pittsburgh is dedicated to green space with 1,700 acres of city parks and more trees per square mile than any other U.S. city.

qa_list.question: What is the reason Pittsburgh ranked #10 in Niche.com ranking?
qa_list.answer: Pittsburgh ranked #10 in Niche.com ranking due to its dedication to green space, with 1,700 acres of city parks and more trees per square mile than any other U.S. city.

qa_list.question: How many unique neighborhoods does Pittsburgh have?
qa_list.answer: Pittsburgh has 90 different vibrant neighborhoods, each owning distinctive culinary and cultural traditions.

qa_list.question: What is the reason for Pittsburgh's emergence as a tech and culture hub?
qa_list.answer: Pittsburgh has been praised by The Washington Post for its world-class art museums and colorful neighborhoods, contributing to its status as an emerging tech and culture hub.

qa_list.question: What is the achievement of Carnegie Mellon University Department of Athletics in 2022-23?
qa_list.answer: Carnegie Mellon University Department of Athletics finished 14th in the 2022-23 Division III Learfield Directors’ Cup standings, recording its highest finish in the 28-year history of the Learfield Directors’ Cup.

qa_list.question: What is the purpose of visiting the website mentioned at the end?
qa_list.answer: Visiting the website allows students to complete a recruit questionnaire and learn more about Carnegie Mellon University's athletics programs.

qa_list.question: Why are there terms of service, privacy policy, report abuse options provided at the end?
qa_list.answer: These options are provided to ensure a safe and respectful online environment for all users by outlining rules and guidelines, protecting user data, and allowing users to report any inappropriate behavior.

qa_list.question: What is the significance of 'Next' and 'Previous' options provided at the end?
qa_list.answer: These options allow users to easily navigate between different sections or pages within the website, providing a more user-friendly experience.

doc_text:
View Static Version

Loading

Carnegie Mellon Athletics Discover what being a Tartan is all about

Carnegie Mellon is a 140-acre urban campus with a residential feel due to our dedicated green space and campus life commitment. We are located just 3 miles east of downtown Pittsburgh and next to the largest public park in Pittsburgh - Schenley Park.

Interactive Map

Interested in visiting campus? You can find the location of our athletics buildings by visiting the interactive campus map.

Facilities

From a picturesque stadium that hosts football games and track and field meets, to a natatorium with natural lighting and the only dedicated soccer facility in the University Athletic Association with the construction of a new performance gym for basketball and volleyball, Carnegie Mellon Athletics boasts some of the premier sports arenas in Division III.

Under Construction - New Health, Wellness and Athletics Center

Includes Performance Gym for volleyball and basketball with multipurpose areas for indoor training for all sports.

Student-Athlete Groups

ADPI Student-Athlete Group

With a student-athlete population of almost 30% Tartans identifying as ADPI, we bring diversity and change to athletics. Carnegie Mellon is a prestigious university where we value individual well-being and community support, and it’s important for all of our student-athletes to feel welcomed and supported by the environment that we create. To provide a safe space for Asians, Desis, and Pacific Islanders, we can come together to support each other’s cultures, improve the issues we face in competition, and celebrate who we are. 2

Black and Latinx Athlete Coalition

A cohesive, centralized affinity group and network of support, camaraderie and mentorship amongst Black and Latinx student-athletes and alumni.

Plaidvocates

The Plaidvocates are a peer health and wellness advocacy program for student-athletes that supports the well-being of CMU’s varsity athletics community.

Student-Athlete Advisory Council (SAAC)

We work to promote the student-athlete voice and engage in community outreach.

Unique Programming

SMART Program

The Sports Medicine Assessment of Risk Tendencies (SMART) Protocol is a proactive, cutting-edge approach to providing varsity student-athletes with services they need to remain healthy and educated about their well-being.

Find out more

Tartan Leaders of Tomorrow

A program in which Carnegie Mellon Student-Athletes evolve as leaders through engaging speakers, thoughtful discussion, campus outreach, engagement and proactive mentorship.

Find out more

Learn More

Learn More

Academic Success

Career and Professional Development Connections

The department of athletics partners with the Career and Professional Development Center for special events that are centered around student-athletes connecting with employers.

For more on the image to the left, connect with the CPDC's Post-Graduation Outcomes page

Pittsburgh

Home to 6 different colleges and universities in a 7-square mile radius from campus

Ranked #9 in Livability.com 2022 ranking of Top 100 Best Places to Live

Ranked #10 in Niche.com ranking of 2022 Best cities for young professionals in America

City dedicated to green space with 1,700 aces of city parks and more trees per square mile than any other U.S. city

90 different unique and vibrant neighborhoods owning distinctive culinary & cultural traditions

Pittsburgh is emerging as a tech and culture hub that The Washington Post praises for its "world-class art museums and colorful neighborhoods."

More About Pittsburgh

2022-23 Success

The Carnegie Mellon University Department of Athletics finished 14th in the 2022-23 Division III Learfield Directors’ Cup standings, as announced by the National Association of Collegiate Directors of Athletics (NACDA). Carnegie Mellon totaled 777.00 points to record its highest finish in the 28-year history of the Learfield Directors’ Cup, topping 2022's finish of 15th.
